details.title: A Cutsets-Based Unified Framework to Evaluate Network Reliability Measures

authors.affiliation: Reliability Eng. Centre, IIT Kharagpur, Kharagpur, India

p: Rajesh Mishra completed his BE (Electronics Eng.), and M.Tech. (Reliability Eng.) in 2000, and 2004, respectively. After working as a lecturer for three years, he is currently pursuing his research at the Reliability Engineering Centre, IIT Kharagpur, (WB) India.

authors.name: Rajesh Mishra

authors.affiliation: Reliability Eng. Centre, IIT Kharagpur, Kharagpur, India

p: S. K. Chaturvedi (M'06) is currently working as an Assistant Professor at the Reliability Engineering Centre, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur (WB) India. He received his Ph.D. from the Reliability Engineering Centre, IIT, Kharagpur in 2003. He has research interests in the areas of network reliability, life-data analysis, and optimization. He has published papers in several international journals. He is also a reviewer for IEEE, IJPE, and IJQRM; and is an associate editor of IJPE.

authors.name: S. K. Chaturvedi

details.abstract: This paper presents a minimal cutsets-based unified framework to evaluate some commonly used reliability measures: g-terminal, 2-terminal, and k-terminal reliability. In doing so, the paper proposes a single algorithm, which generates the network node sets. From these node sets, depending on the reliability measure(s), only those node sets are kept, which contains at least one node from the specified node set. These selected node sets form link-minimal cutsets. These minimal cutsets are used as an input to multi-variable inversion-based sum-of-disjoint product approach to obtain the unreliability expression thereafter. By solving several network examples of varied complexities, the comparison with the existing approach is provided.
